title: 108_hr2820
content: Extension of National Guard authorities to Mayor of the District of Columbia. Extension of National Guard authorities to Mayor of the District of Columbia. Section 6 amends the Act to replace "President of the United States" with "Mayor of the District of Columbia" in various sections related to the militia. This includes appointing commissioned officers and the Reserve Corps. Section 9, 13, 19, and 20 of the Act are amended to replace references to the President with the Mayor of the District of Columbia. This includes changes in appointing commissioned officers and the Reserve Corps. Section 20 of the Act is amended to replace references to the President with the Mayor of the District of Columbia. This includes changes in retirement and general courts martial procedures. SEC. 2. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS TO TITLE 10, UNITED STATES CODE. Amendments to title 10, United States Code include changes to sections regarding training details, failure to perform training, and the appointment of the Chief of the National Guard Bureau. The amendments involve replacing references to the governor or appropriate authority with the Governor of the State, Territory, or Puerto Rico, or the Mayor of the District of Columbia. Amendments to title 10, United States Code involve replacing references to the commanding general of the District of Columbia National Guard with the Mayor of the District of Columbia in various sections. Amendments to title 10, United States Code involve replacing references to the commanding general of the District of Columbia National Guard with the Mayor of the District of Columbia in various sections, including sections 12406 and 18238. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS TO TITLE 32, UNITED STATES CODE. Amendments to Title 32, United States Code include changes related to the National Guard of the District of Columbia, such as appointing the Mayor instead of the commanding general for certain roles and removing references to the commanding general in various sections. Amendments to Title 32, United States Code involve appointing the Mayor of the District of Columbia instead of the commanding general for certain roles within the National Guard and updating references in various sections. Amendments to Title 32, United States Code involve replacing the commanding general of the District of Columbia National Guard with the Mayor of the District of Columbia for specific roles and updating references in different sections related to the National Guard. Amendment to Title 32, United States Code replaces the commanding general of the District of Columbia National Guard with the Mayor of the District of Columbia for specific roles. Amendments are made to the National Defense Authorization Act and the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, specifying the roles of the Mayor of the District of Columbia in relation to the National Guard.
